alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Randolph; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 3:27AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Randolph, southeastern Lewis, Upshur, northern Webster and Barbour Counties through 400 AM EDT... At 326 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms near Rock Cave, or 9 miles south of Buckhannon, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elkins, Buckhannon, Philippi, Audra State Park, Belington, Dailey, Rock Cave, Beverly, Junior, Womelsdorf (Coalton), Montrose, Pheasant Run, Alexander, Eden, Cleveland, Bowden, Kanawha Head, Overhill, French Creek and Moatsville. This includes Route 33 between mile markers 5 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Barbour; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Randolph; Upshur
